profileScraperMode.title: Profile Scraper Mode
enumTitles: Short ($0.1 per search page up to 25 short profiles)
Full ($0.1 per search page + $0.004 per full profile)
Full + email search ($0.1 per search page + $0.01 per full profile)
profileScraperMode.description: Choose the mode for scraping LinkedIn profiles. The Short mode provides basic information, while the Full mode includes full detailed profile data.

searchQuery.title: Search query (fuzzy search)
searchQuery.description: Query to search LinkedIn profiles. (e.g., `Founder`, `Marketing Manager`, `John Doe`). [The query supports search operators](https://www.linkedin.com/help/linkedin/answer/a524335)

maxItems.title: Maximum number of profiles to scrape
maxItems.description: Maximum number of profiles to scrape. The actor will stop scraping when this limit is reached.

locations.title: Locations Filter
locations.description: Filter Profiles by these LinkedIn locations. Example: `San Francisco`. LinkedIn does not always understand your text queries. For example for "UK" query it will apply "Ukraine" location, so you should use "United Kingdom" in this case. Try this out first in the location filter input of LinkedIn search at `https://www.linkedin.com/search/results/people/?geoUrn=%5B%22103644278%22%5D` - we will use the first suggestion from the autocomplete popup when you type your location

currentCompanies.title: Current Company Filter
currentCompanies.description: Filter Profiles by these LinkedIn companies. Provide full LinkedIn URLs

pastCompanies.title: Past Company Filter
pastCompanies.description: Filter Profiles by these LinkedIn past companies. Provide full LinkedIn URLs

schools.title: School Filter
schools.description: Filter Profiles by these LinkedIn schools. Example: `Stanford University`.

currentJobTitles.title: Current Job Title Filter
currentJobTitles.description: Filter Profiles by these LinkedIn current job titles. Example: `Software Engineer`.

pastJobTitles.title: Past Job Title Filter
pastJobTitles.description: Filter Profiles by these LinkedIn past job titles. Example: `Software Engineer`.

yearsOfExperienceIds.title: Years of Experience Filter
yearsOfExperienceIds.description: Filter Profiles by these LinkedIn years of experience IDs. Example: `3` for '3 to 5 years'.

yearsAtCurrentCompanyIds.title: Years at Current Company Filter
yearsAtCurrentCompanyIds.description: Filter Profiles by these LinkedIn years at current company IDs. Example: `3` for '3 to 5 years'.

seniorityLevelIds.title: Seniority Level Filter
seniorityLevelIds.description: Filter Profiles by these LinkedIn seniority level IDs. Example: `120` for 'Senior'.

functionIds.title: Function Filter
functionIds.description: Filter Profiles by these LinkedIn function IDs. Example: `8` for 'Engineering'.

industryIds.title: Industry IDs Filter
industryIds.description: Filter Profiles by these LinkedIn industry IDs. Example: `4` for 'Software Development'. Full list: `https://github.com/HarvestAPI/linkedin-industry-codes-v2/blob/main/linkedin_industry_code_v2_all_eng_with_header.csv`

firstNames.title: First Names Filter
firstNames.description: Filter Profiles by these LinkedIn first names. We recommend using another actor for searches by name: https://apify.com/harvestapi/linkedin-profile-search-by-name

lastNames.title: Last Names Filter
lastNames.description: Filter Profiles by these LinkedIn last names. We recommend using another actor for searches by name: https://apify.com/harvestapi/linkedin-profile-search-by-name

recentlyChangedJobs.title: Recently Changed Jobs Filter
recentlyChangedJobs.description: Filter Profiles to only those who have recently changed jobs.

excludeLocations.title: Exclude Locations Filter
excludeLocations.description: Exclude Profiles by these LinkedIn locations. Example: `San Francisco`. LinkedIn does not always understand your text queries. For example for "UK" query it will apply "Ukraine" location, so you should use "United Kingdom" in this case. Try this out first in the location filter input of LinkedIn search at `https://www.linkedin.com/search/results/people/?geoUrn=%5B%22103644278%22%5D` - we will use the first suggestion from the autocomplete popup when you type your location

excludeCurrentCompanies.title: Exclude Current Company Filter
excludeCurrentCompanies.description: Exclude Profiles by these LinkedIn companies. Provide full LinkedIn URLs

excludePastCompanies.title: Exclude Past Company Filter
excludePastCompanies.description: Exclude Profiles by these LinkedIn past companies. Provide full LinkedIn URLs

excludeSchools.title: Exclude School Filter
excludeSchools.description: Exclude Profiles by these LinkedIn schools. Example: `Stanford University`.

excludeCurrentJobTitles.title: Exclude Current Job Title Filter
excludeCurrentJobTitles.description: Exclude Profiles by these LinkedIn current job titles. Example: `Software Engineer`.

excludePastJobTitles.title: Exclude Past Job Title Filter
excludePastJobTitles.description: Exclude Profiles by these LinkedIn past job titles. Example: `Software Engineer`.

excludeIndustryIds.title: Exclude Industry IDs Filter
excludeIndustryIds.description: Exclude Profiles by these LinkedIn industry IDs. Example: `4` for 'Software Development'. Full list: `https://github.com/HarvestAPI/linkedin-industry-codes-v2/blob/main/linkedin_industry_code_v2_all_eng_with_header.csv`

excludeSeniorityLevelIds.title: Exclude Seniority Level Filter
excludeSeniorityLevelIds.description: Filter Profiles by these LinkedIn seniority level IDs. Example: `120` for 'Senior'.

excludeFunctionIds.title: Exclude Function Filter
excludeFunctionIds.description: Filter Profiles by these LinkedIn function IDs. Example: `8` for 'Engineering'.

startPage.title: Start Page
startPage.description: The page number to start scraping from.

takePages.title: Scrape search pages
takePages.description: The number of search pages to scrape. Each page contains 25 profiles.
